intro: Uragoga ciliatostipulata, commonly known as the hairy-stipule uragoga, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive hairy stipules and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom during the warm season. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Uragoga ciliatostipulata is typically found in moist, shaded environments in tropical regions.
